name: Salawara Estate : 1486, Karnataka (SCA 84+) : Naturals (Medium Roast)
description:
Single Origin Coffee: Salawara Estate, Karnataka

Medium Roast (250g)

Process: Natural

Agtron Meter: 62

Altitude: 1050 MASL

Varietal: SLN. 795

Cupper's Notes: Strawberry, pineapple, maple syrup

Flavour Meter


Best Brewed With

FILTER ROAST

Manual brewing methods fall under the artisanal brewing style of coffee. Roasting a coffee is also an art, we have developed this filter roast to maintain the quality while brewing over Pour over, Kalita, V60, Origami, April, Chemex.

About the process:

Natural : The optimal block for coffee picking is identified and selected from the estate based on ripeness and quality. Only the ripened cherries are carefully picked, and any defects, including unripe cherries, twigs, and other foreign particles, are removed. A sample lot is taken to measure the Brix level (24). Lighter coffee fruits and foreign materials are removed through floater removal, and the cherries are de-stoned to eliminate unwanted materials. The denser coffee cherries are double washed for cleanliness. The coffee fruits are placed in double-walled stainless steel tanks, and selected cultivated yeast is added for the fruit and allowed to ferment anaerobically for 72 hours, with regular monitoring of fermentation. The tanks are rotated 2-3 times a day for homogenous fermentation. The fermented coffee is moved to a greenhouse for drying on raised beds to maintain temperatures, and it is raked hourly to ensure even drying. for a period of 23 days. Once the desired moisture level is achieved, the coffee is bagged in gunny bags and allowed to rest for 3-4 months before hulling.

name: Specialty Excelsa (SCA 86+): Mooleh Manay Estate, Coorg, Karnataka, India: Lot #Kempu - Black Honey (Medium Roast)
description:
Single Origin Coffee from Mooleh Manay Estate, Coorg, Karnataka

Medium Roast (250g)

Process: Black Honey

Agtron Meter: 63

Altitude: 1000 MASL

Varietal: Excelsa

Cupper's Notes: Jackfruit, Starfruit, Muskmelon

Best Brewed With

FILTER ROAST


Please note that the best brewed with list is not comprehensive and does not dictate that the coffees cannot be brewed with any other methods. These are the the methods we think will extract the best possible cup. However, this coffee can be ground and enjoyed with any brew method that you desire.


About the Process


Black Honey: The coffee is harvested only in March and April, as Excelsa beans take 12 months to ripen. After harvesting, the cherries are floated and later undergo anaerobic fermentation both before and after pulping for a total of four days. This process leaves much of the mucilage on the beans, giving the cherries a rich burgundy hue as they dry slowly on raised beds.


Flavour Meter


Cupper's Notes

This cup offers an incredibly sweet experience, starting with a prominent jackfruit flavor that transitions into notes reminiscent of star fruit. The mouthfeel is akin to muskmelon, providing a smooth and delightful finish.

About the Origin

Komal Sable, along with Akshay Dasrath, together run Mooleh Maney Estate and the South India Coffee Company, where they produce sustainable and environmentally responsible high quality coffee using traditional farming techniques. Their plantation is located in North Coorg, on the banks of the Harangi backwaters in the foothills of the Western Ghats.

name: Project Pearl, Ratnagiri Estate, Karnataka (SCA 86+): Alchemy - Naturals (Medium-Light Roast)
description:
Single Origin Coffee: Project from Ratnagiri Estate, Karnataka

Medium Light Roast (250g)

Process: Naturals

Agtron Meter: 73

Altitude: 1340 MASL

Varietal: Catuai

Cupper's Notes: Black grapes, chamomile, cinnamon

Flavour Meter


Best Brewed With

OMNIROAST


Please note that the best brewed with list is not comprehensive and does not dictate that the coffees cannot be brewed with any other methods. These are the the methods we think will extract the best possible cup. However, this coffee can be ground and enjoyed with any brew method that you desire.

About the process:

Naturals: This lot undergoes a carefully controlled fermentation process using Lactic Acid Bacteria (LAB), Saccharomyces, and Pichia, each playing a crucial role in shaping its sensory profile. LAB introduces a smooth, creamy acidity that enhances the coffee's texture, while Saccharomyces yeast amplifies vibrant tropical fruit and floral notes, adding depth and complexity. Pichia, a key refining agent, ensures a clean and well-structured fermentation, allowing the distinct flavors to shine without overpowering one another. The result is a meticulously balanced cup with a rich, dynamic expression of acidity, sweetness, and clarity.

About Project Pearl



In the Indian Specialty Coffee Industry, the name Ratnagiri Estate evinces a recognition of steadily elevating excellence, innovation, and a devotion to sustainability. The name Ratnagiri itself, translates to pearl mountain.


Over the years, Ratnagiri Estate's legacy in the Indian specialty coffee industry has steadily elevated as the flagbearers of specialty coffee growing, processing, and Indian specialty coffee representation overseas.


Today we’re honoured to be able to tell their story in the fullness of their legacy, with Project Pearl — a microlot program featuring 8 microlots from Ratnagiri Estate, exclusive only to Subko, that showcase the high-scoring, experimentally processed coffees that are a testament to their humble beginnings.

Allergens: Contains Dairy (Vegetarian)

name: Subko VLGE, Paderu, Andhra Pradesh - Gurram Hand Washed (Medium Roast)
description:
Single Origin Coffee from SUBKO VLGE: Co-operative Agriculture: Paderu Valley, Andhra Pradesh

Medium Roast (250g)

Process: Gurram Hand Washed

Agtron Meter: 60

Altitude: 935 MASL

Varietal: Sln. 9

Cupper's Notes: Honey, Walnuts, Brown Sugar


Best Brewed With

ESPRESSO ROAST

Please note that the best brewed with list is not comprehensive and does not dictate that the coffees cannot be brewed with any other methods. These are the methods we think will extract the best possible cup. However, this coffee can be ground and enjoyed with any brew method that you desire.

About the Process

 

Gurram Hand Washed: The process, known as "Gurram Hand Washed," involves a small tribal community using their bare hands to pulp coffee fruits after fermentation. They then wash or demucilage the coffee with their hands.

 

Flavor Meter

Cupper's Notes

This coffee lot, roasted for an espresso brew or strong extraction, boasts a flavor profile reminiscent of sweet honey and walnuts, coupled with a heavy body. It features a prolonged, brown sugar-like finish and notes of caramel candy. The mellow, citric aftertaste is akin to that of a semi-ripe dragon fruit.

 

About Subko VLGE: Co-operative Agriculture

A sustainable, farm-to-table-to-farmer operation by Subko

Founded by Subko Specialty Coffee Roasters and Craft Bakehouse, the Subko Co-op initiative finds its roots in the village of K. Thadiputtu in Andhra Pradesh. Concentrating its efforts on the holistic advancement of the 'Subko Village,' Subko Co-op has adopted a cluster comprising six tribal farmers from K. Thadiputtu village in Paderu, Andhra Pradesh. With a dedication to bringing these individuals to the forefront of the third wave of coffee, Subko Co-op seeks to not only empower these farmers but to also nurture growth within their entire community.

This initiative is focused on tribal farmers who cultivate coffee on government-allotted lands. With an attention on driving direct trade, sustainability, and hyper-traceability, the initiative embodies a commitment to elevating the agricultural landscape in the world of coffee. This endeavor aims to adopt more such clusters in the future. Furthermore, Subko Co-op envisions the establishment of training centers, designed to empower and educate both farmers and their families, paving the way for them to become coffee professionals and authentic representatives of their cultural legacy and heritage. Subko Co-op’s objective is to emerge as a transformative force, reshaping the narrative of coffee cultivation by amalgamating sustainable practices, cultural preservation, and community empowerment, and to narrate origin stories and recognise every stakeholder who puts their heart in coffee cultivation.

name: Pourtable Pourover [ Box of 6] (84g): The Subko VLGE Blend
description:
Pourtable Pourover coffee bags feature Subko’s VLGE Blend from Padera, Andhra Pradesh, offering a rich, layered profile with hazelnut praline, plum jam, and milk chocolate notes. This isn’t instant coffee, it’s instant you. Ready when and where you need it. 

Subko’s Pourtable Pourover is a single-cup drip coffee brewer that combines the precision of manual brewing methods like Kalita and Origami drippers in a portable format. Just add hot water and brew specialty coffee wherever you are, without compromising on quality.

name: Muskurahat Ka Taufah: Coffee Drip Bags + Dark Chocolate Minis + Chocolate Series |  Subko Coffee Roasters
description:
For Specialty Coffee and Fine Cacao purveyors: a combination of a convenient Portable Pourover, 2 single-origin dark chocolate minis and a collection of 6 half bars from our Dark/Milk/White chocolate series.

What's in the box:

1) Choose between Subko's Pourtable Pourovers (Box of 6) – Subko VLGE Blend from Padera, Andhra Pradesh or The Project Pearl from Ratnagiri Estate, Karnataka x 1

Subko’s Pourtable Pourover is a single-cup drip coffee brewer that combines the precision of manual brewing methods like Kalita and Origami drippers in a portable format. Just add hot water and brew specialty coffee wherever you are, without compromising on quality.

Pourtable Pourover coffee bags feature Subko’s specialty Arabica blend from Project Pearl, Ratnagiri Estate, Karnataka. Each box includes six sachets, offering a floral, fruit-forward cup—this isn’t instant coffee, it’s instant you. Ready when and where you need it.

Pourtable Pourover coffee bags feature Subko’s VLGE Blend from Padera, Andhra Pradesh, offering a rich, layered profile with hazelnut praline, plum jam, and milk chocolate notes. This isn’t instant coffee, it’s instant you. Ready when and where you need it.

2) Dark/Milk/White Chocolate Bars (Half Bars)(30gms) x 5
a) Dark/Milk/White Series: When Coffee Met Cacao (63% Dark) x 1
A 63% dark chocolate bar that showcases Karnataka state’s ever-generous gift to the Subcontinent — Kaapi Culture, and combines the two agricultural bounties of the state that often grow in a single spot. This bar features single-origin fine cacao sourced from Varanashi Farms, Karnataka combined with a limited edition specialty coffee project (Project Pearl) from Ratnagiri Estate, Karnataka.
Allergens: No Allergens (Vegan)

b) Dark/Milk/White Series: The Salty One (65% Dark) (30gms) x 1
A traceable, Himalayan Pink Salt-infused 65% dark chocolate bar, made with a blend of cacao beans sourced from West Godavari, Andhra Pradesh.
Allergens: No Allergens (Vegan)

c) Dark/Milk/White Series: The Classic One (45% Milk) (30gms) x 1
A 45% milk chocolate bar that harkens to the memory of a classic chocolate experience, with the Subko Cacao signature. Featuring single-origin Forastero cacao from Thekkinthandu, Kerala and fully traceable A2 Milk Powder co-developed and sourced from Native Farms, Maharashtra.
Allergens: Contains Dairy (Veg.)

d) Dark/Milk/White Series: The Flat White (37% White) (30gms) x 1
The absurd prospect of a milk-based espresso beverage, as a single-origin gourmet chocolate bar? We made it happen. name: Jashn Ka Taufah: Spicy Coated Chocolate + Spread | Subko Coffee Roasters
description:
For chocolate enthusiasts: a duo of Fine Cacao selections.

What’s Inside the Box?

1) Coated: Podi Milk Chocolate Almonds (150gms) x 1
A unique fusion of South Indian Mulagapodi Gunpowder Masala and specialty milk chocolate, creating a bold Indian twist on Mexican Chili Chocolate.

Made with traceable, house-made Podi Masala, infused into single-origin 45% milk chocolate sourced from Thekkinthandu, Kerala, and centered around roasted almonds for a satisfying crunch. Experience an oscillating flavor journey between spicy and sweet!

Allergens: Contains Nuts and Dairy (Vegetarian)

2) Hazelnut-Based Milk Chocolate Spread x 1
A creamy, nutty, and ultra-luxurious hazelnut milk chocolate spread, made with hyper-traceable, locally sourced ingredients and zero palm oil. This is Subko Cacao’s version of a spreadable Rocher, featuring Turkish Hazelnuts blended with single-origin cacao from Kaithapara, Kerala. Enjoy it on toast, biscuits, cakes, pancakes, in smoothies, or straight from the spoon!
Cacao Origin: Kaithapara, Kerala
Allergens: Contains Dairy and Nuts (Vegetarian)

Please note that your order will be delivered in 7-10 days due to specific shipping requirements for items containing spreads.

description:
An eclectic selection for those on the wonderful road to craft discovery: Our bundle of Speciality Coffee Pourtable coffee bags and Fine Cacao selections.


What’s Inside the Box?
1) Subko Pourtable Pourover Sachets x 6 sachets
Enjoy the art of handcrafted coffee, wherever you are. Our single-cup Pourtable Pourover sachets offer the precision of manual brewing with the convenience of portability. Simply add hot water and savor a specialty coffee experience without compromise.

3 Sachets - Project Pearl, Ratnagiri Estate, Karnataka: Floral and fruit-forward, offering a nuanced specialty Arabica blend.

3 Sachets - Subko VLGE Blend, Padera, Andhra Pradesh: A rich, multi-layered profile with hints of hazelnut praline, plum jam, and milk chocolate.

Forget instant coffee—this is instant you. Ready whenever and wherever you need it.

2) Dark/Milk/White Series: Collection Box of 5 [Half Bars]
A meticulously crafted collection of 5 half bars (30g each), taking you through a journey of flavors from rich dark chocolate to creamy milk and indulgent white chocolate.

a) When Coffee Met Cacao (63% Dark) – A tribute to Karnataka’s legendary Kaapi Culture, combining fine cacao from Varanashi Farms with Project Pearl specialty coffee.

b) The Salty One (65% Dark) – A Himalayan Pink Salt-infused dark chocolate made from single-origin cacao beans of West Godavari, Andhra Pradesh.

c) The Classic One (45% Milk) – A nostalgic milk chocolate experience, crafted from Kerala’s finest Forastero cacao and A2 milk powder from Native Farms, Maharashtra.

d) The Flat White (37% White) – A bold coffee white chocolate bar, merging Ratnagiri Estate’s Arabica Microlot Coffee with creamy white chocolate.

e) The Vanilla White Bar (39% White) – A luscious white chocolate made with A2 skimmed milk powder from Gir Cows and single-origin cacao butter from Andhra Pradesh.

Allergen Information:
Vegan: When Coffee Met Cacao, The Salty One
Contains Dairy (Vegetarian): The Classic One, The Flat White, The Vanilla White Bar

3) Hazelnut-Based Milk Chocolate Spread
A silky smooth, handcrafted milk chocolate spread made with premium Turkish hazelnuts and single-origin cacao from Kaithapara, Kerala.

Free from palm oil and full of rich, nutty goodness, this spread is perfect for:

- Smoothies and desserts
- Or simply eating straight from the jar with a spoon!

- Subko VLGE Blend, Padera, Andhra Pradesh – A rich and layered coffee profile with notes of hazelnut praline, plum jam, and milk chocolate.

Forget instant coffee—this is instant you. Ready whenever and wherever you need it.

2) Dark/Milk/White (Full) Bars (50gms each): x 5
An exquisite collection of five full-sized chocolate bars, spanning the flavors of dark, milk, and white chocolate.
a) When Coffee Met Cacao (63% Dark) x 1 – A tribute to Karnataka’s Kaapi Culture, blending single-origin cacao from Varanashi Farms with Project Pearl specialty coffee.

b) The Salty One (65% Dark) x 1 – A bold dark chocolate infused with Himalayan Pink Salt, made with traceable cacao beans from West Godavari, Andhra Pradesh.

c) The Classic One (45% Milk) x 1 – A nostalgic milk chocolate experience, crafted with Forastero cacao from Thekkinthandu, Kerala and A2 milk powder from Native Farms, Maharashtra.

d) The Flat White (37% White) x 1 – A coffee-infused white chocolate bar, merging Project Pearl Arabica Microlot Coffee with A2 milk powder for a creamy, espresso-like indulgence.

e) The Vanilla White Bar (39% White) x 1 – A smooth, gourmet white chocolate made with A2 skimmed milk powder from Gir Cows and single-origin cacao butter from Andhra Pradesh.

Allergen Information:
Vegan: When Coffee Met Cacao, The Salty One
Contains Dairy (Vegetarian): The Classic One, The Flat White, The Vanilla White Bar

name: Project Sankalp Garo Hills, Meghalaya (SCA 86+): Lot #OC-15A - Anaerobic Slow Dry Naturals (Medium-Light Roast)
description:
Origin: Garo Hills, Meghalaya 

Lot Number: #OC-15A

Medium Roast (250g)

Agtron Meter: 75

Process: Anaerobic Slow Dry Naturals

Varietal: Sln 795 + Cauvery

Best Suited: Omniroast

Altitude: 800 - 900 MASL

Cuppers notes: Raw Mango, Cinnamon, Prunes


Best Brewed With

Please note that the best brewed with list is not comprehensive and does not dictate that the coffees cannot be brewed with any other methods. These are the the methods we think will extract the best possible cup. However, this coffee can be ground and enjoyed with any brew method that you desire.

About the Process

Anaerobic Slow Dry Naturals - The anaerobic slow dry process is a specialized coffee processing method that combines anaerobic fermentation with a slow drying phase. Coffee cherries are sealed in a container for fermentation in an oxygen-deprived environment. Following fermentation, the cherries undergo slow drying, which allows for gradual moisture removal and optimal flavor preservation. This meticulous process results in unique flavor notes such as fruity, floral, and wine-like characteristics, paired with a smooth mouthfeel. It requires precise control and careful attention to detail. Coffees processed using the anaerobic slow dry method are highly valued for their distinctive flavor profiles.

 

Cupper's Notes

This is a unique cup that Subko has to offer. The palate is greeted with a bright acidity reminiscent of raw mangoes. A cinnamon-like flavor is then perceived, bringing a spicy nuance to the cup. The experience concludes with a mouthfeel and sweetness similar to prunes.

 



 About Garo Hills Project Sankalp

The Indian Northeast basks in the limelight a lot rarer than other parts of the country. With the introduction of the Garo Hills as a specialty coffee origin in 2020, a watershed moment came to be. In 2023, with the introduction of high-scoring specialty coffee from the Garo Hills under the umbrella of Project Sankalp, or ‘Garo Sankalp’, processor Waribok Daribok has elevated the coffee grown there by tribal smallholders — popularly referred to as the ‘Achik’ in collective — to a specialty caliber worthy of international recognition.

 

 

About The Origin

About the estate Indigenous, native citizens of Meghalaya, in India's Northeast, the Garos refer to themselves as 'A'Chik'. Classified as a 'Sino-Tibetan' language, 'Garo' is spoken in the Garo Hills districts of Meghalaya. Garos are interestingly also one of the few matrilineal societies globally, where clan titles are traditionally taken from the mothers' side.

Garo gastronomic culture is equally diverse. Millet, maize, tapioca, goats, pigs, fowls, ducks, deer, raw honey, and bamboo shots to name but a few gastronomic drivers of the region. Arabica coffee, however, is rarely on such lists.

We're humbled to share that there is small-lot production of Arabica coffee production in Meghalaya, thanks to the tireless work of native Meghalayan Waribok_Daribok. Our Q-Grader has found that these coffees cup well beyond the threshold for specialty coffee, with certain roast profiles surpassing the SCA 85-point level we aim for with our specialty sourcing model.

Cultivated at elevations of 850-965 Mtrs MASL by smallholder farmers and not at any formalised estate, these specialty coffee cherries were grown, harvested, picked and then naturally shade dried below 35 Centigrade with intermittent raking on what are referred to as 'African raised beds.'

name: The Spirit Series: Subko VLGE, Paderu, Andhra Pradesh - Cask Barrel Aged (Medium Roast)
description:
Single Origin Coffee from SUBKO VLGE: Co-operative Agriculture: Paderu Valley, Andhra Pradesh

Medium Roast (250g)

Process: Gurram Hand Washed

Aging Method: Cask Barrel Aged

Agtron Meter: 60

Altitude: 935 MASL

Varietal: Sln. 9

Cupper's Notes: Irish Cream, Muskmelon, Rosewood


Best Brewed With

Please note that the best brewed with list is not comprehensive and does not dictate that the coffees cannot be brewed with any other methods. These are the methods we think will extract the best possible cup. However, this coffee can be ground and enjoyed with any brew method that you desire.

About the Process

Gurram Hand Washed: The process, known as "Gurram Hand Washed," involves a small tribal community using their bare hands to pulp coffee fruits after fermentation. They then wash or demucilage the coffee with their hands.

Cask Barrel Aged: A meticulous dance of 500-liter barrels, housing our meticulously selected single-origin Arabica microlots, orchestrating real-time innovation. The result? A fusion of whiskey nuances in a non-alcoholic coffee brew. 0% ABV. 100% vegan. Presenting ‘Sharab’ Cask Barrel Aged Specialty Coffee by Subko. Richly layered with the essence of oak and sherry butts, imparted during coffee fermentation and aging in a cask barrel for 77 days. Craft spirits meet specialty Gurram Hand Washed arabica coffee. From Subko VLGE in the village of K. Thadiputtu from Paderu region in Andhra Pradesh. Filter roast, with the richness of Irish Cream and the lusciousness of Musk Melon + sweet finish of Rosewood. As deeply rooted in the subcontinent as it gets.


Flavour Meter

Cupper's Notes

The Gurram hand-wash processed coffee from the Paderu region in Andhra Pradesh undergoes a unique aging process, spending 77 days inside whiskey barrels. As a result, this lot is distinguished by tasting notes that emobody rich sweetness like that of Irish Cream, the mouthfeel mirrors the lusciousness of Muskmelon, and the long-lasting sweet finish reminisces the essence of Rosewood.




About Subko VLGE: Co-operative Agriculture

A sustainable, farm-to-table-to-farmer operation by Subko

Founded by Subko Specialty Coffee Roasters and Craft Bakehouse, the Subko Co-op initiative finds its roots in the village of K. Thadiputtu in Andhra Pradesh. Concentrating its efforts on the holistic advancement of the 'Subko Village,' Subko Co-op has adopted a cluster comprising six tribal farmers from K. Thadiputtu village in Paderu, Andhra Pradesh. With a dedication to bringing these individuals to the forefront of the third wave of coffee, Subko Co-op seeks to not only empower these farmers but to also nurture growth within their entire community.

This initiative is focused on tribal farmers who cultivate coffee on government-allotted lands. With an attention on driving direct trade, sustainability, and hyper-traceability, the initiative embodies a commitment to elevating the agricultural landscape in the world of coffee. This endeavor aims to adopt more such clusters in the future. Furthermore, Subko Co-op envisions the establishment of training centers, designed to empower and educate both farmers and their families, paving the way for them to become coffee professionals and authentic representatives of their cultural legacy and heritage. Subko Co-op’s objective is to emerge as a transformative force, reshaping the narrative of coffee cultivation by amalgamating sustainable practices, cultural preservation, and community empowerment, and to narrate origin stories and recognise every stakeholder who puts their heart in coffee cultivation.

source_data.title: Experimental: The Cold Brew Chocolate Tart Bar
source_data.body_html:
The ultimate flavourful and textural Cold Brew Tart (CBT) experience in a craft chocolate bar, inspired by one of our first bakehouse creations. Featuring a Robusta Coffee Spread, made with Single Origin Coffee from Salawara Estate, Karnataka, Roasted Chopped Hazelnuts and a crisp Cacao Biscuit Base, all paired with a 70% Dark Chocolate shell made with Subko Cacao, this one's a delight.

name: Dark/Milk/White Series: When Coffee Met Cacao (63% Dark)
description:
A 63% dark chocolate bar that showcases Karnataka state’s ever-generous gift to the Subcontinent — Kaapi Culture, and combines the two agricultural bounties of the state that often grow in a single spot.

This bar features single-origin fine cacao sourced from Varanashi Farms, Karnataka combined with a limited edition specialty coffee project (Project Pearl) from Ratnagiri Estate, Karnataka.

Coffee Origin: Ratnagiri Estate (Project Pearl), Chikmagalur, Karnataka

Cacao Origin: Varanashi Farms, Karnataka

name: Longevity Jar (Jar only, No Beans)
description: Subko's philosophy merges lot-wise roasting, consistent cup quality control, and hyper traceability to all the Specialty Coffee Associations green and roasted bean standards. This humble specially screen printed bottle can store your beans in an airtight environment, help maximise shelf life, and preserve aromatics and flavours of your whole beans or grounds.

name: Origami Coffee Dripper
description:
The Origami Dripper is inspired by the Japanese art of folding paper that it’s named after. Made with Mino Porcelain, the dripper is made up of 20 channels which allow you to use both Kalita Wave and V60 Filter Paper while keeping the brewing process smooth and clog-free, giving great control over the dripping speed.

The acrylic dripper holder base plate is designed separately to prevent any heat loss during the brewing process. 

NOTE: Acrylic dripper holder base plate included.

Specifications: 
• Material: Porcelain
• Recommended Filters: Hario V60 #2 or Kalita Filters #185
• Heatproof Temperature: 120 degree celsius
• Care: Dishwasher safe, hand wash recommended.
